description: Buy the Klymit Insulated Static V Ultralite Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Insulated Static V Ultralite Pad
hasVariant.description: Buy the Klymit Insulated Static V Ultralite Pad online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This pad is not at all comfortable. The panels make it feel very lumpy. I did not sleep weel at all in this pad
review.name: This pad is not at
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.reviewBody: Though lightweight and takes up very little room inside my pack it is too small for my 5'11" frame and is very noisy to sleep on. When I roll around and air moves in the baffles it makes a horrible squeaking sound.

Valve would not seal and leaked. Played with it all night long flipping, twisting , holding, even googled advice from the mountain to no avail. Next day descended and purchased another exact  pad and had the same problem. Unreliable one way valve. Had no sleeping pad for a weeks expedition.   won't be giving the chance for a third strike.
review.name: Flat out.....well flat

review.reviewBody: I have 3 Klymit sleeping pads, 2 of the pads claim to be insulated to an R Value of 4.4. Recently the ASTM rating has changed these pads to an R Value of 1.9. It appears I have been deceived about how well insulated these pads really are.
review.name: ASTM R Value

review.reviewBody: I have 3 Klymit sleeping pads, 2 of the pads claim to be insulated to an R Value of 4.4. Recently the ASTM rating has changed these pads to an R Value of 1.9. It appears I have been deceived about how well insulated these pads really are.
review.name: ASTM R Value

review.reviewBody: Very good for cold weather to keep you warm in the sleeping bag.

Having owned two of these sleeping pads, one being replaced by Klymit at no great hassle I should be in a position to recommend this pad - but unfortunately I am not. It is always such a downer when gear fails through no fault of your own, especially when you care for it well. The first pad sprung a leak at one of the heat treated seam as it slowly seperated over time. This mat was replaced at no hassle or cost to me. But, around this exact time my second Klymit mat (exactly the same line, purchased at the time as the other one) started leaking from the valve. I am not going to bother getting this one replaced as I am exasperated by this point and disheartened that this product has such obvious issues that cause failer in the field when they are required most. I understand most lightweight mats of many of the best brands experience very similar issues, I am at a loss as to how to proceed!
review.name: Great Customer Support But Poor Product Execution - 2x Mat Failures

review.reviewBody: Having owned two of these sleeping pads, one being replaced by Klymit at no great hassle I should be in a position to recommend this pad - but unfortunately I am not. review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable straight out the box! Loved the style and fit.
review.name: Banging boots

review.reviewBody: Love it, Comfortable to wear. Good insulation and looks great.
review.name: Lovely shoes

review.reviewBody: Classic style and exceptional comfort right out of the box. Love them.
review.name: Slabtown 62

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These were super cute and comfy. They were really lightweight which was awesome for hiking around at the end of summer. These were broken in while on a trip to Maine where we hiked around. They were super stable on the rocky paths. Looking forward to wearing these more this fall.
review.name: Cute, lightweight and durable

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love these boots! They have the look of another popular brand but have the added benefit of being waterproof. 

I have worn them around my house because I live in Florida and it’s still to hot to wear boots and jeans still. However, while wearing them around my house, I did find them comfortable and stylish. They do give you quite a bit of height as well. 

These boots feel very durable and sturdy. I am so happy to have them in my closet! Thanks Influenster! I was gifted these boots in exchange for my honest review.
review.name: Sturdy and stylish

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Thank you influenster for allowing me to review these Sorel boots. Made in Vietnam, the boots say they are  waterproof. I can't find anywhere on the box or the boot what material they are made from, but I can tell they are synthetic, not leather. The inner liner seems to be a canvas material. They're a sharp looking boot that I think could go well in both a country or city setting. They seem well put together and have a very cushy inner sole and  a moderate arch support. I have a wider ball area with normal heel width. These boots  were too tight through the ball area for me to walk  comfortably, so I can't speak to durability over time. They seem to be true to size in length with a normal width. If you have a wider front foot or bunions,  these may not work foryou. In all fairness and based on the cloud feeling inner sole, these boots would be a decent choice for those looking for a non-leather option.
review.name: May squeeze your toes

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The hybrid work/casual boot style is really nice. Appreciate that these are waterproof and leather instead of a synthetic upper. The suede tongue improves the comfort and the sole has good grip while still offering some cushion. The toe box is roomy without being too wide. Seems like really durable construction that will hold up in wet fall/winter weather conditions.
review.name: Sturdy and nice looking boot

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots are not only comfy but they’re strong and long lasting! They’re great for multiple things whether you wanna use it for hiking or as your fashion statement piece for your outfit! I love how strong they feel, the materials are high quality and easily adjustable. I chose a bigger size than my feet simply because I wear thick socks during the winter time. The waterproof aspect with the grip of the heels really help in all weather situations!
review.name: Weatherproof and cute!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These boots have held up to hours of walking for my job. They are comfortable and true to size. Compared to other boots these ones don’t make my feet sweat so much.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I had received these boots from Sorel and was looking forward to going hiking to get them broken in. Upon opening the box, the scent of leather was the first thing I had noticed. The boot is comfortable and will fit just right with my hiking socks. I have not been able to go on a hike with them just yet.

A couple days before we were set to go hiking, I ended up having some problems with my heart condition, so that made me postpone plans. I will absolutely come back with an update after I get to put these to the test of a hike and some water exposure to test the waterproofing.
review.name: Comfortable and supportive

name: Slabtown 62 Six WP Boot - Men's

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves this jacket. Our winter temperatures routinely dip below-30C and this jacket has been keeping my child warm and comfortable enough for her to continue having fun outside.
review.name: Awesome jacket

review.reviewBody: These fit my son perfectly. We went out to ski (very tame green/bunny hill) and they broke within 2 hours of being there. Like the plastic actually snapped on the back suspender part and we had to remove them. Not impressed. My other son got the same pair in a smaller size and the clasp where it attaches to the pants broke the 3rd day we skied. And we are very tame skiers. My first time buying and I am not impressed.
review.name: Straps broke on the first use

review.reviewBody:
Amazing service and fantastic quality. These are our fourth pieces and are already well loved by the kid. When they CHOOSE the warm stuff even in the summer, you know it’s good! 

We are an alpine ski family and these pieces keep both kids on the hill longer.
review.name: Warm kids are outdoorsy kids!

name: Proxima Pant - Toddlers'

description: Buy the Petzl Meteor Climbing Helmet online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Meteor Climbing Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl Meteor Climbing Helmet online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
My head measures around 18.5 cm (7 3/8 in) with a soft tape measure.  The size M/L works excellent for me with plenty of adjustment room to wear a hat or thin toque underneath.

I have used this helmet for both ice and rock climbing, with no issues or complaints.  The headlamp clips have come in handy and never failed.  I personally really like the chin strap buckle.  It has a magnetic attachment, which helps to guide the buckle when securing.  Quite easy to unlatch as well as adjust the fit.

Very lightweight and doesn't dent or show wear like many Black Diamond helmets I've used in the past.  Would not advise putting this helmet in your checked bag if you're going on a climbing trip though...  Lesson learned the hard way.

If you're a lady reading this, there is a female specific version that works better with a ponytail, which my wife uses and loves.
review.name: Best one I've Found

review.reviewBody: This is my first climbing helmet. Used this past summer on via ferrata and a couple of Colorado 14ers. Super light and comfortable--vents well in hot temps. The adjustable harness for the noggin pushes down into helmet, so I'm not worried about it breaking when shoving helmet into pack. Looking forward to using it this winter from some ski touring/winter climbs. Overall, great helmet.
review.name: First helmet = great helmet

review.reviewBody: I use M/L size and  head circunference is about 58 cm and the helmet has more centimeter of advantage for bigger heads or to use it with bandana, balaclava or beenie.
review.name: Very light and spacious.

review.reviewBody:
The helmet itself is light, comfortable, and well ventilated. It also has a thin plastic shell to help protect the softer foam from the kind of light touch damage the bd vapor and vector suffer from.

It even comes with a bag! The bag is a joke however. It only fits about 2/3 of the helmet. We've tried all orientations, and the only way the helmet almost fits is crown down, with the opening by the opening, but even then you can't close the bag. The bag is a cheap material anyway. You'd think they would have sprung for an extra 2° worth of material to actually cover the helmet, or not include the joke of a bag at all.
review.name: Great lightweight comfy helmet

review.reviewBody:
This is not only a super light and comfortable helmet, it is very durable. I bang it up quite a bit, but it still doesn't have dents. I like the clips for ski goggles or a headlamp, as it's easy to put on and feels secure. 

The one flaw is that the magnetic buckle on the helmet strap collects dirt and can get in the way of buckling it sometimes. Can be quite annoying.
review.name: Comfortable, light helemt

name: Meteor Climbing Helmet

description: Buy the Bern FL-1 Libre Road Bike Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: FL-1 Libre Road Bike Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the Bern FL-1 Libre Road Bike Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Was super suspect about ordering a road helmet online without trying it on. In the past I ordered the wrong size MTB helmet from SMITH and was nervous to order the wrong size once again. However I am SO stoked I decided to roll the dice and order bucket on a whim. It fits great, doesn't look too dorky and has superb ventilation.  Only knock on it is that there is no easy way to store shades on top like most of its competitors. Despite that I am still going 5 stars on the review for price, fit and look. Lastly,  I no longer have people mean mug me as I ride by on my gravel bike without a helmet on, highly reccomend this helmet
review.name: LOVE this helmet

name: FL-1 Libre Road Bike Helmet

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Could not be happier with these shoes. Stylish but most importantly, super super comfortable. Not inexpensive, but to me totally worth the price!
review.name: Love these shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: This is a preliminary review after living room try on. Toe box is great for a wider foot. The heel straps are a goofy design. From photos & marketing text, one would think they are velcro tightening adjustable. No, they are just superfluous. The laces connect to the front strap, which connects to a solid plastic triangle, which connects to the passive heel strap. The lacing force does not transfer to the heel, no way. Basically it looks like a stick & dirt catcher to me. But the fit is good, so I'll review again when put to a real test.
review.name: "Heel lock" is not adjustable

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wish they fit!! Way too narrow for wife feet. Reviews said "widest toe box" . Maybe for narrow feet not even close for EE feet. Wwaaayyy too narrow for EEE Feet. Wide toe box and all. Like I said they looked really nice, just too narrow
review.name: Looked good!

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Wanted to like these shoes but ended up returning them. The heel keeps slipping and the side straps doesn't really allow you to tighten them beyond a certain point. Not sure why since tightening up around the ankles would probably eliminate heel slipping. What's the purpose of the back strap anyways? Guess I'm dumb but back strap doesn't tighten in any way. Does not move forward if you pull lace straps so what is the purpose? Thought it was for tightening the heel but nope...not at all unless I just couldn't figure it out.
review.name: Heel slips

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Shoes are tight on the top of the foot. Heel slips out. Just not a good design.
review.name: Wouldn't recommend

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have difficult time because one foot is larger than the other. Womens medium width not wide enough so went to mens and took a few tries to find correct size. I think I found the perfect shoe and am anxious to have now that weather is turning sloppy.
review.name: Finally found correct size after 3 tries.

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had high hopes because I love my sandals. But these shoes just hurt. And I don't know if I can send them back or not. They look new still. My heel does not stay in the shoe because the back of the shoe is so low. But this is a walking/light hiking shoe so I thought my foot should stay in it. And I am wearing the correct size. Also, this hurts across the top of my foot. I have to walk differently in these so my foot does not slip out and to avoid the pain, and then my calf muscles and foot arches end up hurting. I would LOVE to exchange this for something else. But I don't know if the company would do that? I bought it online from the Teva company.
review.name: This shoe hurts my foot and ankle.

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Fits fine, looks good. I assume will wear ok. Can't stand the side straps which always fall off the shoe lace when tying up. Irritating, and for an outdoor shoe, trying to retie in inclement weather is not only a chore, but can be a safety issue.
review.name: I like Tevas, but would never buy this particular shoe again

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Actually, this is my husband's 2nd pair from Teva and he loves the comfort. Definitely waterproof is what he needs to walk the dog in the early morning. These shoes are perfect!
review.name: I would buy these shoes again.

review.itemreviewed: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not as much cushion in these, feet hurt after wearing them all day
review.name: Not the same as my older ones

name: Grandview GTX Low Hiking Shoe - Men's

review.reviewBody: I purchased this backpack approximately 3 months ago but wanted to test it out in multiple conditions before giving it a review.  Heat, snow, alpine this pack preformed super well !  Great design with super high quality durable construction.  What really stands out is the way that it fits.  With its stretch chest panels and dual chest straps it fits like a glove making it a high preforming pack as well !!!
review.name: Way to go !

review.reviewBody: Nice profile against the back for getting through brush, and 35L is just about what I need to keep gear focused. I currently have 35Lbs of the gear I carry (larger med kit, water and basic gear) and it's pretty comfortable; lots of ways to adapt fit. The main body material is very light and strong but some of the fabric choices, such as the hip belt pockets and side bottle pockets have an elasticity that doesn't feel quite as solid but is usefully stretchy.
review.name: New SAR Bag

review.reviewBody:
What a great pack! If you're serious about taking a trail this is the pack for you. Heavy enough to carry anything you need, light enough to be considered an extended day pack.
Mystery Ranch really hit a home run with this line.
review.name: Wonderful pack!!

review.reviewBody: Bought it for rucking and camping.. love the comfort and functionality of it! Highly recommend
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack in preparing for the Du Mont Blanc  hike but ultimately decided this pack was a bit larger than I needed. But I did test it out a bit with the kit I prepared to day hike with. This pack has to be the most comfortable pack I’ve ever tried on. The yoke material and padding is superior to the normal setup by mystery ranch. And not that the regular one is uncomfortable at all. The dual chest harness design hugs you like a vest and takes the load off your shoulders for even more comfort. It is a bit different or odd to have a dual chest strap but extremely comfortable.  This pack is also slim in design that causes the gear you pack to become tighter to your body, nearly flat compared to a round obtrusive bulge on your back. This provides some ease of maneuver if you might get in amongst some trees and thick brush I imagine. Over all, I would have kept it, but the 35L seemed a bit much for a day hike type pack I was looking for.
review.name: Most comfortable

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack to replace my older one that I've had for 15 years. I was looking for a pack that I could take to last me a day (24-hour pack). The Bridger 35 looked promising, and I wasn't disappointed! This pack offers the essentials for anyone looking to go outdoors for the day. So far, I have taken it out three times for hikes ranging about 5 to 10 miles with around 20-25 pounds of gear, and what I've found is that the pack, when seated right (instructions on how to fit are on the tag, also there are YouTube videos available) this pack takes the weight from your back, allowing you to have a comfortable hike without having to adjust. I have another Mystery Ranch pack (Coulee 50), which I take for a 2-3 (48-72 hour) excursion, and found it to be a fantastic pack, which led me to come back to them for another, where I discovered the Bridger 35, and I couldn't be happier with the results!
review.name: Exactly What I Need in a Day Pack

review.reviewBody: I purchased this pack to replace a Mystery Ranch 25 liter as I needed higher capacity for an extended, four season outing (read: more room for a puffy, Jetboil, etc). It is now my favorite two/three day pack and will replace my current go bag for the vehicle. It is well thought out, well designed and has the same quality for which MR is known.
review.name: Fabulous Midsize Pack

review.reviewBody: I finally got this out yesterday for a longer hike, and wow, was I impressed. I had to adjust the torso pad a little, and once I had that dialed in, I hardly knew it was on my back. And that was with about 23 pounds of gear. They really hit it out of the park with this design. The runner's harness chest setup helps distribute weight so well, I almost didn't need the hip belt. The pack has just the right amount of organization (I'd recommend getting a zoid for the hangers above the bladder sleeve) and I love the way it can function both as a top-loader and as a panel loader, with the side zips allowing it to fillet out and make access very easy. I do wish there were a few more pockets on the chest harness, like a zippered pocket on one or both sides for flatter devices like a phone, but just having the two is so convenient. Love this pack!
review.name: Amazing pack

review.reviewBody: I bought this pack this past summer, and didn't bring out until shoulder season and now the winter. I've had the opportunity to load this up with 25ish pounds to this point and it carries extremely well. Have done a 12 and 7 mile winter day hike most recently, and it carries all my essentials + layers for the winter extremely well. Had a 2L bladder inside + 2 liters on the outside and I didn't feel like the pack was uncomfortable in the slightest. As well, I brought it out for a winter overnight and was able to carry all my gear (pad, two quilts, tent externally) without a single issue along with 2L of water, essentials, and extra layers. It was snug, but the pack had no troubles!
review.name: Super Winter daypack/overnighter!

review.reviewBody:
I've always used Gregory products (and I still do), but a purchased this to replace a well-used Zulu 40.  The double strap "joggers" harness took a little bit to get used to but what a game changer.  It enables this pack to fit more snuggly and comfortable than any other i've come across.  The breathable endurance yoke provides a lot of comfort as well and is easily adjustable.  This may sound weird, but both pockets on the hip belt zip towards you (from left to right, back to front) and this makes them infinitely easier to use while wearing the pack with the hip belt clipped.  I also dig the mesh lined holders on each side of the interior of the backpack.  The material seems sturdy and I appreciate all of the attach loops.  I also like that there are two straps at the bottom of the pack that you can use to attach things such as a tarp (similar to a larger overnight packs).  

Now for some of my drawbacks (I'll try not to be as "nitpicky" as a lot of the hiking community seems to be about gear).  The water bladder holder is small.  I tried to put on empty Platypus 2L in it and I had to really shove it in (empty), which makes me think I would def. not try to put a full bladder in.  I also used a similar Gregory water bladder that was taller and thinner (2L) and it would probably fit full, but it comes way up to the zipper of the pack.  The water bottle holders on the strap don't hold bottles much more than a 24oz Polar squeeze bottle.  I can't really equate that to the collapsable bottles because i don't use them, but I would assume it's similar.  Also, this pack is manufactured in VIETNAM, not the US.  I tried looking into that, but never could find out beforehand.  I should have asked so that's my fault.  

Overall, this pack (in my opinion) is phenomenal.  Unlike most of the hiking community i'm not some hipster, leftist hiking "expert," but I tend to hike around Western PA twice or more times a week and I really think this pack will serve me well.  I recommend reading the "about" section of their website.  It seems like the owners really take pride in their products and have created this brand out of passion, not necessarily for monetary gain.  Is it pricey...yes (i'll admit I was blessed enough to receive a discount), but I still believe the old adage is true...you get what you pay for.
review.name: A pretty remarkable day pack

name: Bridger 35L Backpack

review.reviewBody:
These are my go to climbing pants when I go outdoors. Super comfy and allows you to stretch for reachy moves. 
I like the waistband and how it doesn’t feel bulky with a climbing harness over it. I’ve worn these a ton and they’re still holding up great.
review.name: My favorite climbing pants.

review.reviewBody:
Haven?t wore them on rocks or gym yet. I ordered these and Hampi pants to compare and they initially felt more stiff and thick, but they are very comfy and stretchy on my to my surprise (actually better than Hampi in my case). Both 2 and 4 fits fine on my waist (26??), with 2 a little tight on hip and 4 a little loose (I have the ?Asian straight? XD torso and hips). Went for a 4 after talking to gearhead b/c they say the cotton material may shrink a little after hot wash. Hoping the waistband doesn?t stretch out overtime since they are fitting just fine right now. Overall very nice pants and good quality. Blue is true to color and I like the waistband pattern a lot.

On another note I do hope Patagonia makes an inner pocket in Caliza like what they did in Hampi.
review.name: Great rock pants so far

review.reviewBody: These pants are pretty much the perfect design. Fabric is stretchy and seems will hold up to the rocks I live near in JT. I think they will not be too heavy except during the very hot season. High waist is great n not too high. For me the fit is a little big. I?m usually a 10 in Pat, but these fit in 8. Length is little long, but ankle snaps and ability to cuff makes it just fine. Four pockets are great and big. My issue is that UPS (Backcountry choice) had some problem about delivering them. Two phone calls to BC didn?t resolve anything so finally went to UPS to pick up myself. BC said they called, but I don?t think so. Pants get 5 stars, BC gets 2.
review.name: Perfect pants, late delivery

name: Caliza Rock Pant - Women's

description: Buy the Ergon SM Pro Saddle - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SM Pro Saddle - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ergon SM Pro Saddle - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: SM Pro Saddle - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Ergon SM Pro Saddle - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Saddles are particularly hard to review as they are some of the most body particular gear out there. That said, i love my SM pro as it fits me perfectly...and my WTB volt didn't. That's basically the bottom line. I used the cardboard method to measure sitbones and ordered accordingly. Seems like a solid value in these days if triple digit saddle prices. It's not the lightest but respectable. The padding is firm, which I like (I'm an old Flite guy, if that gives you perspective). All in all, happy with my purchase.
review.name: ergon saddle

review.reviewBody:
When it comes to mountain bike saddles, there's no real competition to Ergon.   Spesh makes great saddles for road, but MTB is all Ergon.

Highly recommend, but I also recommend that you figure out your sitbone width in person with an Ergon dealer, or know your sit-bone width.   If you  dont know your sitbone width, Ergon has a calc on their website where you put in hips, height and weight and its always small.   But I know my width and it sizes me M/L.  

I have all ERgon saddles on my 4 MTB's and they're the best.
review.name: Best saddles on the market

review.reviewBody:
I've spent hours to measure properly size I need and always Ergon tools were recommending S/M size. Quality of materials is definitely better than my stock saddle. 
But I can't say it's the best saddle I ever used. It's good for sure but not the best. Maybe I just need large size. Another point is actual outfit on you. Biking on this saddle would be better if your shorts are designed for MTB.
review.name: Mixed feedback

name: SM Pro Saddle - Men's

review.itemreviewed: CLUG MTB XL Bike Storage Rack
review.reviewBody:
Kinda torn. Just got this for a 2.4 width tire. The tire was absolutely swimming inside of this mount. Set it up regardless and the bike almost immediately fell out of the mount. I'm considering a new bike this year with 2.6" stock tires so I'm probably going to keep it for that, but the sizing is way off. 

I bought the hybrid version as well and it is far more accurate to my steel touring rig. That mount hugs the tire exactly how I'd expect based on the specs. This MTB XL is just way off.
review.name: Neat idea, clean design.

review.itemreviewed: CLUG MTB XL Bike Storage Rack
review.reviewBody: This mount is awesome I bought 3 of them one for mine and my wife’s mountain bikes and one for my road bike. The installation instructions are easy to follow and it installs in about 5 minutes. Make sure you are drilling into a stud and you should have no issues! If you are on the fence about what size to buy size down. My tire is a 2.5in and it has a little wiggle room in the XL!
review.name: It’s like magic!

name: CLUG MTB XL Bike Storage Rack

review.reviewBody: fits great.  very soft.  love the thumb holes.  seems very breathable.  love it.  I think I'll get another!
review.name: wow!  incredibly soft and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I know its a trade off between being cooler and being more protected, but I can certainly hope for the perfect super light hoody that blocks all the suns rays.  This one feels heavier, and when you're the water its more clingy than their previous ones
review.name: Heavier fabrice than before

review.reviewBody: I've had one of these for several years now, and have worn it practically to death = just kidding! The fabric is a little heavier than Patagonia's Capilene Cool; but it still functions perfectly in sun and heat.  I think flats fishermen would especially like it; all fishermen, actually, as a little added protection from rays reflecting off the water.  I dinged it one star because when you deploy the button under your chin, the hood hem on either side gaps a little bit.  Some people might not exactly like that discrepancy; but it doesn't faze me and doesn't detract from the overall appearance of the garment.  In summation,  if you want a sun hoody that's a tad "heavier" than Capilene Cool, this one's the ticket!
review.name: Works like A Charm

Buy the Anker 625 Solar Panel 100W online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 625 Solar Panel 100W
hasVariant.description: Buy the Anker 625 Solar Panel 100W online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am enjoying my 100W solar panel. It compliments my Solix 1000. It will serve me well on all my off-grid adventures.
review.name: ANKER the anchor of off-grid adventures

review.reviewBody: This is my second time getting a solar panel, first from Anker and this is reliable and consistent. I used it to charge the battery in my anker dual side cooler and it kept the cooler working for 3 days no issues. The solar panel is easy to travel with and set up. Have only had it for a month but it seems sturdy and durable.
review.name: It just works

review.reviewBody: Must say, I was skeptical of these powerhouse products at first, but have been nothing but impressed with the performance! I purchased an Anker powerhouse 757 earlier this summer. I bought it to use on my boat and it’s been exceptional!! The wife and I pull up to party cove, kill the accessories on the boat and plug everything into my powerhouse. We run a box fan, an 1100W stereo, a 32” tv & a portable pellet smoker. It last us the entire day (6+ hours) without dying. I purchased the solar panels to help collect free energy from the sun while we are out on the water. I was impressed with my initial use of the solar panels to recharge my powerhouse this past weekend. Very easy to set up and reposition to gain the best sunlight. Only negatives I will say about the panels is that the panels were heavier than expected & that Anker should include a female connector so that you can connect cords for extended length. Plan to use my solar panels to recharge my powerhouse while boating. Plan to use the solar panels Labor Day weekend to recharge my powerhouse while in use. Gonna use it to power my 58” tv, fan, stereo, & smoker for kickoff to college football!….I plan to make a YouTube video labor day weekend to let everyone know how it goes!
review.name: Overall impressed!

review.reviewBody: Easy to use, easy to set up, works as it should is all you can ask for and this I feel does just that
review.name: Quality built

review.reviewBody: Excellent piece of accessory! A must have if you own any anker chargers!
review.name: 100 w solar panel

review.reviewBody: Great solar panel. i bought this solar to compliment my 200 watt Anker solar panels.
review.name: Great purchase to add to my Anker collection

review.reviewBody: From initial review it looks sturdy and like it will work for camping. Will update review after more use.
review.name: Sturdy

review.reviewBody: The build quality of this panel is top notch and the addition of the solar alignment tracker is a neat touch and helps you align properly without the guess work. There are three adjustable legs on the bag, the two smaller ones and the large one with the storage pouch and if all three are used it’s quite stable. Output seems to be on par with other panels on the market.
review.name: Awesome 100w Solar Panel

review.reviewBody: So I purchased one along with my 757 solar generator. I love the design of the panel and the little sun dial on it to help with aligning it with the sun to increase efficiency. I will be adding 2 more to the collection for the full 300 watts.
review.name: Great Panel!

review.reviewBody: I used it with the power station running an electric cooler on max mode and a pedestal fan for nine hours and still had 50 percent battery left.
review.name: Keeps the 555 power station going

name: 625 Solar Panel 100W

review.reviewBody: I bought all 4 colours, 6 foot, 210 lbs, athletic, large fit perfect. They are short but not too short. By far the best shorts I've ever bought. Would buy again and if more colours come out I'll buy those too.

review.reviewBody: Super confortable shorts for sport or any activity. I wore them while travelling, while not as stylish as other Ferrosi models, they are definitely wearable for day-to-day use.

review.reviewBody: These shorts are fantastic. The small I purchased fit perfect. Zipper pocket is awesome as I can keep a payment card on me and it won't get lost or fall out. I'll be buying every colour.
review.name: A for sure winner

review.reviewBody: Light, good looking shorts perfect for athletic movement, everyday use, or hiking (they can double as swim shorts if needed!) Not tear resistant, so not ideal for activities that could rub against or tear at them, great for anything else.
review.name: Go-to Shorts

review.reviewBody: These shorts are so light and comfortable! Awesome active summer shorts and at the gym.
review.name: 10/10 would recommend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I can't seem to stop wearing these shorts during this oppressively hot, Louisiana summer. I'm 5'10, 190lbs and 7 inch inseam shows a little thigh but not too much. Keep in mind there are no back pockets so carrying a wallet, keys, phone, etc. in two front pockets is a little annoying but I don't think the shorts would be as lightweight and comfortable with the pockets.
review.name: Can't stop wearing

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These shorts feel amazing to wear and are extremely comfortable. They are very light and feel great while working out of hiking.
review.name: The perfect short

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, lightweight but with more rugged Ferrosi fabric on the back side. Very useful pockets. Perfect for everyday use and I have multiples of black, gray and blue. I don't love the green, but it would be great to have these in other colors. Sand/khaki or something bright. I have them in men's and women's and find the men's to be more practical for every day wear.
review.name: Best shorts for everyday use

review.reviewBody: I bought this for wearing when I walk my dog in Winter. Wearing just leggings or tights, I can stay nice and warm even when it's Minnesota cold out. It's not terribly long so I can still move easily and it really does the job I was hoping it would! Highly recommend!
review.name: Toasty and warm!

review.reviewBody: I love throwing these on over my leggings after taking off my ski pants! It helps me stay warm, especially when sitting on a cold chair outside. Perfect for apres ski or anytime! I'm a size 26 and the small fits great & not too snug.
review.name: Best Apres Ski Skirt

review.reviewBody: I was looking for something cute and somewhat girl for the colder months that would still keep me warm. This skirt was exactly what I was looking for, keeps your bum nice and warm and looks great. doesn't look too bulky. I wasn't sure about the sizing so i wanted to test it out. order the xs (i'm a size 26) and it comes off a mini skirt with a snug fit. On the website now to order a size small for when I want to tuck a top in, and i'm ordering 2 since my mom keeps borrowing this skirt (she's a size 27).
review.name: Nice and Toasty :)

name: Stansbury ALLIED Down Skirt - Women's

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Best fleeces. Cozy and warm, with vivid colors and an awesome philanthropic message. 

Don’t hesitate. It’s gear for good—seriously. I have sent in an item for repair and had an excellent experience.
review.name: LOVE Cotopaxi!!

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
Been watching and looking at these jackets for quite awhile.  Finally pulled the trigger when they went on sale.  
Pros.   Love the design, colors, hood, and fit.
Cos.  A little disappointed in quality of fleece.  Not the nice thick, high quality fleece that jackets are usually/ or used to be...made of.  Hoping when I wash it may thicken a bit  
Shipping took a long time, that was a disappointment.
It does run a bit large.  I'm 5'6, 150, 36 D. Not tight in the chest at all which is common issues for me.
Hope this helps♥️
I think it will be great for cool weather, and camping which is when I will mostly wear it.
review.name: Runs large

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
My favorite fleece jacket ever!! I love the colors, styling, and fit. This jacket is so cozy, has perfect pockets, and blocks the wind. It’s
My first Cotapaxi jacket and absolutely my first of many.
review.name: Teca Fleece Full Zip Jacket!

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: Beautiful design, colors, and very warm for the Chicago weather. I loved that it has multiple pockets (inside, outside). It is unbelievable warm and light. Definitely, one of my best, legit purchases in jackets. Also, the name and the logo!!
review.name: Unique

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: This jacket is perfect for cooler days and easily layered for colder nights. Fit true to size.
review.name: Warm and Comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I got a message to review my new coat ordered exactly 1 month ago today, and I have to admit I'm disappointed.  It hasn't come yet!  Here are the attributes of said coat:

Fabric:  Looks good in pictures
Warmth:  On the fence. It's cold here.   If like my wife to be able to wear it to be warm.
Color:  Hopefully it looks like the pictures, not sure yet.

Loving this coat!  (That was totally sarcasm, I just wish I had my coat)

Picture of not a coat for reference.
review.name: What?

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I liked the style and especially the hood of this jacket. The colors are cheerful. It fit a bit large but the issue that made me return it was the fleece shed little fibers. I was wearing a black tshirt and was literally covered. I considered washing it to see if that would tighten up the fleece but worried I couldn’t return it and it’s too expensive to have such a glaring problem. I felt the fleece was not very soft and definitely not what I’m used to. I was sad to return it but the fleece quality was not ok.
review.name: Shedding fleece

review.itemreviewed: Teca Fleece Hooded Full-Zip Jacket - Women's
review.reviewBody: I ordered a small because you were out of medium to try it. It was a little too snug in the chest so I returned it.

review.name: Marmot Highlander Down Vest

review.reviewBody:
I don't know why people are saying it runs big.  I could barely zip it up.  I'm on the muscular thick side, but have two other marmot vests in larges and this is like a medium even with just a t-shirt on.  And it's even tighter than the highlander jacket somehow. Half the other marmot jackets I owe are all larges as well.  

Maybe they put the wrong size tag on it at the factory because it fits like a medium on me. I even checked to make sure it wasn't a woman's.

Really nice if you are slender though.  Maybe it's time to take a few laps I guess.
review.name: Really Nice vest, SLIM fit

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Silkweight Sun Hooded Shirt - Infants'
review.reviewBody: I ordered it and after almost a month of waiting i messaged customer service and they let me know that there was a “glitch” so they would re process it. I ended up waiting another 3 weeks still nothing so i requested to cancel and they refunded. Will not be ordering from this website in the future
review.name: Never received item
comment: That’s not the experience we wish to create for any of our customers. Thank you for bringing it to our attention!  We want to apologize for how things went down with this order and the delays.  We've emailed you to resolve the situation

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Silkweight Sun Hooded Shirt - Infants'
review.reviewBody: I now consider this an essential summer item for my infant and for every year as she grows. It’s super light weight, the hood is great since she’s currently rejecting hats (hah), it dries quickly, all good things. Only caveat is it runs SMALL. I read this in other reviews and ordered the 18m for our 10th percentile 10 month old, and it fits fine, the head hole is even a little tight (she is a 90th percentile head). Definitely won’t fit after this summer, but great for now!!
review.name: Essential for infant, runs small

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Silkweight Sun Hooded Shirt - Infants'
review.reviewBody:
Warning before you buy this shirt! It is marked as 18 months on the website, but when I received the shirt, it is actually 12-18 months. Needless to say, I had to make an exchange, but fortunately BackCountry made that extremely easy. 

Everything else, except the size, is perfect.
review.name: Sizing is not listed correctly

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Silkweight Sun Hooded Shirt - Infants'
review.reviewBody: We bought 18 mos size for our 12 mo. Doesn’t fit over his head. His head is in the 65th percentile for 12 mo so not a huge head! We ended up cutting a notch in the neck. Garment is snug on him at 13 mo so I’d recommend sizing way up. He’s in the mid 50s percentile for height and weight at 12 months, so pretty average sized baby.
review.name: Opening too small

name: Capilene Silkweight Sun Hooded Shirt - Infants'

description: Buy the KEEN Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Toddlers' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Toddlers'
hasVariant.description: Buy the KEEN Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Toddlers' online or shop all Kids from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Got these for my Gr8Granddaughter. Lives in Fl. I’ve bought multiple Keen sandals but it’s getting a tad nippy. Got these “sneakers”and she loves them. Easy on and easy off.
review.name: Cute

review.reviewBody: I bought these for my 16m old who's running all over the place. He's worn them on one hike so far and also while about and about and seems to do well in them. They're very sturdy and have ample room in the toe box. They're a bit on the heavier side, so that might be a little bit of a challenge for early walkers and don't flex with steps as much as I'd like for proper foot development but he seems to like them. Plus they're really cute. He's already gotten several compliments for them.
review.name: Adorable and sturdy!

review.reviewBody: These sneakers are so cute on, and fit my little guy's feet well. The rubber over the toes means they still look good, even with my early walker's regular tumbles. I did size up!
review.name: Great shoe for little feet!

review.reviewBody: Perfect for my 18 month old who is a confident walker and climber. Easy to put on and take off , seem comfortable and great fit and are just the cutest.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my two year old to wear on our beginning hikes. Lots of traction, quick drying, and love that she can put them on herself. Very cute and look comfy as well.
review.name: Great quality

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my 2-year old for an Arizona hiking trip. She and the shoes did great! Very easy slip on/off with elastic cord lace and velcro strap. Good fit, and they handled the rocks and loose gravel well. On top of looking cute, their fit and function makes them our new go-to shoes.
review.name: Cute and functional

review.reviewBody: I ordered these shoes for my 2 year old son. He is a very adventurous little boy and these shoes are exactly what he needs to explore, play, climb rocks and hike all in one! Would highly recommend for toddlers! Also, I received 6 different color and size Keen face masks in the box as all. I am a Registered Medical Assistant for MaineGeneral Health in the state of Maine and these masks have caught the attention of all of my fellow co-workers. They love them as do I! Easy to breathe through, great fit and durability! Pretty colors! Highly recommend these. I have given some of the extras that were too big for me to the Nurse Practioner I work for and she was ecstatic! Would love to have more of these in our practice! Thank you Keen for the great work and product you provide!!!
review.name: Best toddler shoes and face masks ever!

review.reviewBody: My 2 year old daughter lives in these shoes. She loves to go hiking in them and they fit her perfectly. Wide, stable and secure with really good traction. Would love more colors, but please do not stop making them, Keen! Highly recommend
review.name: Perfect Shoes for Hiking

review.reviewBody: Easy to get on and off. They are light and easy for my toddler to maneuver in. I love the bright colors and so does he. This is our second pair. He had them in size 5 and now 6.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.reviewBody:
We bought/returned merrels for our 1 year old and they were super heavy and hard to put on his feet. These are light and SO EASY TO PUT ON. He hikes, walks, falls nonstop and the rubber toe surpasses expectations compared to wear on other shoes. 
We bought a 5 (infant) and they seem true to size. Definitely will continue to buy these shoes!
review.name: Total Score

name: Chandler CNX Hiking Shoe - Toddlers'

review.name: Love 'em

review.reviewBody: Smith are the best sunglasses. They look great, work great, and have the best warranty I’ve ever felt with. I will only buy Smith sunglasses and goggles from now on. Thanks Smith!
review.name: Only buy Smith

review.reviewBody: Love these glasses great cross over for style and sport. Still have that high quality chromapop without having that wrap around fishing goggle look. Love these glasses for my everyday. I do swap to my guides choice while on the water most of the time if I have them. but when I don’t these are still a great fishing and all around glasses. Love them for hunting too.
review.name: Love these glasses great cross

review.reviewBody: I love the fit and smith has the best costumer service I have ever spoken to. The glasses are great and the lenses are amazing.
review.name: Love them

review.reviewBody: Love the lens and the color of the frame but the frame arms got real looose real quick. If I lean forward they will slip off my face. I do hope the lens lasts longer than my last pair of smith which delaminated in under two years but the lens and polarization are a selling point. I’m trying to spread the Smith love in Florida
review.name: Cute and lens color is amazing

review.reviewBody: Vision is so clear through them. They are a little wide for my head so they slip when looking down.
review.name: Vision is so clear through

review.reviewBody: Excellent product and customer service. Thank you.
review.name: Excellent product and customer service.

review.reviewBody: I liked the Headliner because of the weight and on water and off water styling. I don’t like the look of the broad-sided cupped-sided ‘fishing’ marketed glasses even though there performance is superior keeping out sunlight and reflected sunlight from the sides and under cheek. I wanted a pair that still had classy styling and a broad enough lens that covered most of my eye, thus the Headliner. The grip is great for my facial features, the fit is secure and comfortable, and the matte finish and copper lens makes my freshwater fishing adventures pop and the fish illuminate within the water. Sight fishing a bronze lens is a must have for rivers and lakes.
review.name: Bronze Brilliance

name: Headliner ChromaPop Polarized Sunglasses

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased for my husbands birthday. He had other Keens just not the leather. They were comfortable with fit and all day comfort. Color (dark brown) is nice and traditional yet goes with everything for men.
review.name: Gift for husband

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: I ordered two pair of sandals for my husband for a trip to Hawaii about two weeks before we were leaving. When we got them, they were too small. The notes on them said to order a smaller size that they ran big, but that was not the case for us. So I called in and told them I needed new ones very fast, and they got them to me within four days. I sent the others back and already got the refund! Very professional very nice very fast. Very good quality product! Worth every penny!
review.name: Good company to work with!!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Bought these shoes for my dad several years ago & he LOVES them- just needed to buy another pair since (for obvious reasons- tread) — bought the exact same pair but they’re different. Straps wayyy too short. Everything else was fine. (Likely are for a little China/Taiwan type foot now.) Super sad. Bummed they don’t work. He was so thankful & excited to know they were coming for Father’s Day. 
Please go back to how things used to be.
review.name: Not the same

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Supportive cushy comfortable like walking on pillows
review.name: Greatest walking shoe ever

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Purchased as a gift for my 70 y/o dad for Father's Day. He put them on right out of the box and wore them for the entire day working and playing at the lake. No breaking-in needed! The soles provided safe traction in wet and dry conditions on a variety of surfaces (dock, brick pathways, dirt/mud, etc), and adjustable straps held feet securely.
review.name: Versatile Sandal

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: I had an American made version of this and I remember it being fitting great right out of the box, these Vietnam shoes not so much. They are off, not super comfortable I hope they break in ok.
review.name: Better when it was American made

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: My third pair of sandals as good as the first pair work or play I wear KEENS
review.name: If I am wearing shoes, they’re keens

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My husband had been looking for a pair of sandals like this for ages. Unfortunately, the strap that goes across the top of the foot is way too short. Others have commented on this as well. Seems like an easy fix, Keen. We'd love to try again in the future.
review.name: Had to return as the strap is way too small

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody: Really needed a pair of sandals that would support my arches well. Have been going through a bought of plantar fasciitis and these provide a very pleasant solution. Perfect for the coming summer months! 👍
review.name: Great comfort

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's
review.reviewBody:
First about sizing. I wear 11 in adidas shoes and 11.5 in Nike shoes and always wear size 12 in slides and most sandals so I went for size 12 in these keen sandals and they were absolutely perfect. They are not big by any measure they fit perfectly. I have bigger than usual ankles so that’s where I would have loved to see some extra room but not to worry they fit just fine on the outer limit for me personally. 

These sandals are very rugged and perfect for hiking as long as you don’t hike on a gravel surface which is what I had to do to climb higher to the hiking path but even gravel did not stop me from enjoying my hike in keen sandals. 

Not they are wonderful for hiking but if you plan on just walking in these then I’d recommend wearing something with a bit more cushioning on the bottom. These aren’t very cushiony? If I can say it that way but they are great for climbing rocks and having a good grip. But for standing around maybe not these. 

You did submerge these in water and like the description claims they are definitely water proof as in they do not get ruined by getting them wet as ordinary leather shoes would. 

These are definitely one of my favorite shoes if I can call it that. 

Enjoy…
review.name: They are perfect

name: Targhee III Open Toe Sandal - Men's

review.reviewBody: comfortable, warm and look great!  love the thigh pocket and lightweight material with slight stretch or "give."  High waisted (thank goodness!) so they actually fit well and stay put unlike many other women's ski pants.
review.name: Great looking and comfortable!

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. They are so comfortable, but still provide the warmth that is needed. I got this with the matching coat and both are great quality and have a great overall fit. The only reason for 4 stars instead of 5 is that the color on the pants isn’t 100% accurate. The fabric on the lower-inner leg is shown as black in the photos online, but is the same color as the rest of the pants in person. I personally like the black better, so I was slightly disappointed about this, but if you don’t mind that detail, then these are worth the purchase.
review.name: Super comfortable and great quality

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I work on my feet every day the whole day. These hikers are really, really comfortable. I got them in black and I am considering getting the green as well. I have wide feet and the toe box has more than enough room for my toes to wiggle. My feet don't slide around inside the shoe and nothing rubs. I don't tie them all the way to the top because I like sliding my feet into my shoes. They do not seem to be waterproof but I didn't buy them to be. For that the Kaha is better.
review.name: Super comfortable

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: One of the most important pieces of equipment I own. My Anacapas provide comfort and support. Lightweight. I'm prone to occasional plantar faciitis and these help to keep me pain free, even on moderately challenging hikes. I love these boots and highly recommend.
review.name: Best hiking boots I've ever owned

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Love the comfort and looks of this pair of boots. My podiatrist recommended Hoka and nothing in my shoe closet now except Hoka! Made such a difference!
review.name: Definitely a Must Have for Fall!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: This shoe was so comfortable when I put it on, like my other Hoka shoes! I had selected this hiking model because it was advertised as waterproof. I took my dog for a walk on dewy grass, not even standing water, and my socks immediately felt wet. Unfortunately I'll have to return them, as I already have other Hoka shoes for walking on dry terrain.
review.name: Not waterproof!

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I exercise in hoka gym shoes everyday, i have 4 pairs. I don't wear anything else, they are so comfortable. I would like for the company to make hoka affordable they are expensive, because I would like to purchase atleast 2 more pairs.
review.name: I love them

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I haven't been able to break them in yet but I love the color combo of the shoe! I did have to size up, normally I am a 10 but I had to get a 10.5
review.name: LOVE THE COLOR

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: Another happy Hoka customer. I wanted a high top shoe for the ankle support after procuring an injury. After trying on a pair in store I knew I had to size up a full shoe size for my wide feet, normal street shoe size is 8.5 Wides and I bought 9.5. These shoes are water resistant for hiking purposes so they don't breathe as much and my feet tend to run a little warmer - I live in Michigan and cooler days are on the way so this is not a issue to me. Hoka is my go-to shoe brand for comfort for work and everyday. I change out of my work hokas for my street hoka shoe.
review.name: Great Shoe size up for wide feet

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I love the color and also the weight. My feet loves this style, i don't feel any pain in my feet. :D
review.name: I have been shopping Hoka Anacapa for 4 years

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: I got a pair of these shoes in night sky 2 months ago. Within a month, the rubber toe cap was coming loose on the inside of the right shoe. Hoka did an even exchange for another pair. (Good!) I've had the second pair for a month. Guess what is happening in the same spot on my new shoes? If you said the toe cap is coming loose in the same place you would be correct. Hoka offered a refund. (Good) And made some recommendations of other models that might work for me.(Good) But good grief!
review.name: Manufacturing flaw

review.itemreviewed: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's
review.reviewBody: At 70, I need the support of these shoes. They give me safety and comfort and stability. And, they are purple ❣️
review.name: Most excellent

name: Anacapa 2 Mid GTX Hiking Boot - Women's

review.reviewBody:
The strap design is low budget, difficult to adjust, and will not lie flat.
Had to return it.
review.name: Nice helmet, but poor straps

review.reviewBody: Great fit, true to size and great visibility! Love the color combination.
review.name: Overall great purchase!

review.reviewBody: I had a bad road bike crash recently. Was airlifted to a spinal facility with fractured vertebrae, ribs and a pneumo thorax. I am on the mend but my new Smith Network MIPS helmet did not survive. It did the job it was designed to do - protect my head. Well worth every cent.
review.name: This helmet saved my life

review.reviewBody: I’ve always preferred Smith Helmets. I just recently had a bike accident on my road bike. I was too fast on a turn and crashed into the woods. I came out with a dented helmet and no concussion. I think MIPs helped to avoid the concussion
review.name: It might of saved my life or concussion

review.reviewBody: I'm not very impressed with this helmet. My biggest concern is that the chin strap doesn't stay tight. It will loosen up over the course of about two hours. So, the chin strap is always loose. I don't feel like that would be very good in the case of an accident. The adjustment tabs on the side also come loose. Not as frequently as the chin strap, but they do tend to open themselves up every couple of days, which is very annoying. Also, the rear ratchet to tighten the helmet around the head is very clunky. By far, it is the most clunky of any helmet I've ever owned. The air flow is okay, not great. The slots in the helmet are quite narrow. They make it really hard to itch a scratch on your head if you have one, requiring you to stop and remove the helmet. I like the color and the design, it just doesn't feel very safe. I'm on a mult-year adventure trip, so I will keep the helmet for now, but I will have my eye open for another helmet when I have the budget for it.
review.name: Not A Safe Helmet

review.reviewBody: Very good ventilation and comfortable. Very difficult to install a light at the back
review.name: Network Mips

review.reviewBody: I’ve ridden 3 networks now for about 5 years without issue but my recent one will not hold onto sunglasses for the life of it. Disappointed in this feature of an otherwise great helmet
review.name: Sunglasses issue

review.reviewBody:
Great style and color selection. Would welcome options for additional padding, especially on top. Any suggestions?

 (I'm a senior male citizen with thinning hair.)
review.name: Great style and color selection.

review.reviewBody: This is my second of these helmets. I wear it on road and gravel rides. I can’t say enough good things about this helmet. It’s comfortable, matches any sunglasses you want to wear, and it’s protective. This is my second one because my previous one saved my noggin on a gravel ride where I got a little fast into a corner. Smashed myself into a tree at high speed, seperated my shoulder, and caved my helmet in. Kept my head safe from the impact. When I was able to get back on the bike I was more than happy to get another one of these to keep me safe out there.
review.name: Best all around helmet!

name: Network Mips Helmet

comment: "5'8" 190 lbs"... Dude, perhaps you should get fit, first. srsly! :) LG's fit/size are spot on. Btw are you aware of what "Fit/form-fit" actually does stand for? Does a triathlon ring any bell?

review.itemreviewed: Lifaloft Full Zip Insulator 3/4 Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: Not sure about the 2021 reviews but these run large and DO NOT have any type of belt or draw string. The waist has stretch but you could easily be trying to pull your pants up on the ski runs. Switched from large to medium.
review.name: Fit big

review.itemreviewed: Lifaloft Full Zip Insulator 3/4 Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: These fit just as the sizing description from HH describes.  I followed the advice based on these comments by sizing up to an XL and they were too large to be able to wear under a ski pant shell.  Not only were they too lose around the waste but baggy in the thigh and a little long to where i think they would go into my ski boot which I'd want to avoid. I'm typically a 34x32 pant size and the XL's fit more in line with a 36-38 waist.  I ended up buying a L which fit perfect and will be returning the XLs.  So stick with the HH sizing recommendation.
review.name: DON'T Size Up

review.itemreviewed: Lifaloft Full Zip Insulator 3/4 Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I'm generally a 34 waist and size L is a comfortable fit. That being said this is one of the more comfortable things I've ever put on my body.
review.name: Definitely Size up

review.itemreviewed: Lifaloft Full Zip Insulator 3/4 Pant - Men's
review.reviewBody: I recently purchased shell bibs (Flylow Baker Bib) to replace my insulated Northface Freedom bibs and I was looking for insulation for the bottom half.  This product is synthetic insulation, so think Helly Hanson Lifaloft or Northface Thermoball.  The pants have zippers along the full length of each side, making it simple to put them on or take them off without having to get undressed.  As long as your bibs have side zips, you can unzip the bib and add/remove this insulated layer.  I am 6'1" 200 lbs 36" waist with thicker thighs and usually wear L pants.  For bibs, I wear an XL and for this product, an XL fits perfectly (so I would say it runs a tad small).  Would recommend for non-insulated shell bottoms.
review.name: Great midlayer for the bottom half

name: Lifaloft Full Zip Insulator 3/4 Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: I have a hard time finding goggles to fit because I am a woman with a small face. Let's face it if the goggles don't fit your face, it doesn't matter how great they are. These happen to also be great in lense quality and number of lense choices. A few years ago I heard these two people on the lift with me discussing smith's "chromo pop" lenses, and raving about them. I can tell you that things pop and are much more distinguishable with Smith's chromo pop lenses. Definitely the best goggles I have ever owned, and worth the investment. I ski alot. I have several of the different lenses, and getting more for different light situations. I have paired them with my smith vantage mips womens helmet, and they fit together nicely.
review.name: Great goggles for a person with a small face

review.reviewBody: Love the look! The color is great and seems like it will work will for a range of lighting. Fits great for my slightly smaller face. Very excited to use them!
review.name: Love the look! The color

review.reviewBody: Bonne visibilité. Un défaut : la lunette n'appuie pas suffisamment sur mon nez; le vent entre dans mes yeux.
review.name: Bonne visibilité. Un défaut :

review.reviewBody: They are women’s size and should fit a smaller face well. I’m not sure if the vent is too big and these are made for spring skiing on a nice day, but my eyes watered the whole time I was skiing on this cold windy day and was basically turning to ice. Precipitation was getting into the lenses and icing over inside. The lighting was fine, but the lenses are hard to change out. These aren’t the cheapest goggles either by smiths. I wouldn’t recommend this particular goggle. I have another pair from smith that I like better and were less expensive.
review.name: Not the pair for me

review.reviewBody: Best goggles ever. Fit my smaller face perfectly! I’m in love with how bright everything looks in lower light. I got LASIK eye surgery and have trouble seeing in lower lights. These work perfect for me! Even on sunny days they’re amazing. Love them!
review.name: LASIK eye surgery

review.reviewBody: The fiit was great for a woman’s face and the lens worked well in sunlight and partly overcast. High quality. I am glad a got a smaller frame as so many are too large. I don’t have a small face and they still were a good fit.
review.name: Great!!!

review.reviewBody: Great fit for my narrow face…and the lenses give super clear visibility.
review.name: Great fit for my narrow

name: Moment Goggles

hasVariant.name: Monaco II Gel Glove - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro Monaco II Gel Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I love this glove. It is snug, comfortable and perfect, even used it for a recent IRONMAN. It is the most perfect padding. I love this glove
review.name: My only go to glove

review.reviewBody: I normally have a medium glove from Giro but you need to go up two sizes larger for this model. I could barely take it off and cut off my blood circulation. Also may rip when removing these.
review.name: Runs Very Small

review.reviewBody: I've had 2 pairs of these. They fit and work fantastically for a few months. Because I have arthritis in both thumbs, these are one of the few gloves that provide just the right amount of padding, not too much, not too little and in all the right places. But, both pair stretched and then tore in one or more places, making the gloves useless. I don't recommend them unless you want a glove for less than 1500 miles of riding.
review.name: They felt and fit great initially

review.reviewBody: The Giro Monoco Gloves have evolved from being a very good mid priced glove ten years ago to being absolute trash on the current version. Stitching tears in hours, uncomfortable, they don't last. I'd like to say to to XYZ company for good gloves but I haven't found that company yet.
review.name: Trash

name: Monaco II Gel Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: I almost returned it because it runs small, but didn’t want to deal with it. It kept me warm. If you don’t mind tight fitting arms then you’ll like it because it is stylish. May want size up.
review.name: Looks nice  but runs small

review.reviewBody: Wore this skiing for one day and there is already a lingering odor even after washing. It is also pretty stiff and not a stretchy material so can only be the bottom layer.
review.name: Not odor proof

review.reviewBody: I like the way this base layer looks but it seems pretty heavy for a lightweight base layer. I also didn't realize it was fleece lined but maybe that's on me. I'm usually a medium in tops and ordered a size up in large and it fits good, not skin tight but not loose either.
review.name: Cute but heavy

review.reviewBody: Very next to skin fitting.  This works great for layering and if you don't like baggy clothes.  I'm 5'2" 112 lbs and wear size small.  If you want it to fit loosely order a size up.
review.name: Warm and cute

review.reviewBody: very nice colors and feel to the fabric, but runs small.  I had to return.
review.name: runs small

review.reviewBody: I'm 5'7, 150 pounds.  Medium fits perfect - snug but not too tight or loose.  Material is soft and I love the print.  Neck zipper is awesome to adjust neck height and love the thumb holes.  Will wear this a ton as a baselayer for all my winter sports - but looks cute enough to wear on it's own!
review.name: Perfect baselayer

name: Lightweight Poly 1/4-Zip Baselayer Top - Women's

review.reviewBody: I’ve been wanting a Pendleton Camp Blanket for many years. Thanks to Backcountry and their Veterans discount I got one. Very nice quality, warm and feels good while sleeping.
review.name: Awesome Blanket

review.reviewBody: I bought this for my husband’s birthday and I think it is his favorite gift I have ever given him! He has used it every single day for over a month now. He absolutely loves it. It has a nice weight to it and isn’t too scratchy. Still not as soft as I would prefer but for wool it’s great. Buying this blanket has turned us into wool lovers, especially for bedding with its temperature regulating properties. Another company we’ve found since this purchase is Wool Room and we have bought their products for our bed.
review.name: Great wool blanket

review.reviewBody:
I’ve had my Yakima blanket for atleast 15 years, maybe more.   

It goes on all my adventures.   From sleeping in my hammock in warmer months wrapped like a burrito, to sleeping in the back of my 97’ 4Runner sh1tbox.  Keeping me toasty, always.

When my kids came of age they received a Pendleton blanket as well with the understanding that this blanket is to be used.  Whether picnics, camping out in the mountains to concerts to wherever their adventures take them.   My daughter just received hers this Christmas at 17 years old.  She was tickled to death and snuggled up in it right away.

Min is a little threadbear around the edges, but still going strong.
review.name: Pendleton … It’s a right of passage

review.reviewBody: Amazing blanket, really good quality. Softly sends me to sleep each night under it's weight and warmth.  This thing is heavy! I liked it so much I am going to buy another one for my parents for Christmas!
review.name: I mean, its a Pendleton!

review.reviewBody: Great hardy blanket - use at home & on trips. Whenever I am going somewhere cold. Always good to have around.
review.name: Great blanket

review.reviewBody: This blanket lives up to the Pendleton name - Made in the USA - Outstanding quality and a rugged wool blanket that will serve you with many years of use.
review.name: Pendleton Yakima Camp Blanket

name: Yakima Camp Blanket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Best rain pants out there. They also double as snow pants over your sweats. They do run large, however.
review.name: But these for rain and snow play!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good pants for wet soccer weather. Kept my son warm and dry between games.
review.name: Good rain gear.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] quality and fit not as expected
review.name: I should have tried it before buying

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good fit!
review.name: Great

review.reviewBody:
These rain pants are real rainpants, and repel the rain. They run a size large, which makes sense in that you are usually putting them on over another pair of something, so I am not mad about that. What I do feel is misleading is the Technical Spec that says it has an elastic waistband and an adjustable drawcord. It has an elastic waistband, but the drawcord is just a piece of elastic with no real way to adjust it. I ended up folding the edge over and tying a slipknot on the elastic to get the pants to stay up for my kid. This could have been solved on the manufacturer's part by adding a $0.09 spring loaded cord lock and then it would be truly adjustable. 

If the specs on this item had been more clear, I would not have purchased this because it does not have a true adjustable waist. If I had to buy this again I would size a size down and expect to still have it slipping.
review.name: Great Rainpaints, but no true drawcord.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Worth the price to keep my kids dry so they keep playing outside!
review.name: Durable for kids who play hard

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] These are nice pants but the sizing is WAY OFF!!! And even stranger, I have lots of other pieces for my kids from TNF and the sizing for those is great. For this, they look like they are literally 2 sizes too big.
review.name: Sizing is way off

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fit is the perfect balance between comfortable and not too baggy. The only downfall is the lack of pockets. Other than that definitely worth the money!
review.name: Almost perfect

name: Antora Rain Pant - Kids'

review.reviewBody: I used to wear the Mammut Tatramar pants but they discontinued them and I think the Stoney are very similar. They fit perfectly. I'm 5'1 and 123# and the 8 short fit like they were made for me. I wear a thin baselayer under them. Perfect for backcountry touring. I love these pants.
review.name: The perfect fit

review.reviewBody: I like them, but I usually wear a size 6 in jeans and pants, sometimes a 4.  I ordered an 8, and they are snug.
review.name: Like, but runs small

review.reviewBody: Very durable/quality material. Bought for skiing and they hold up great. Fit is fairly accurate- I'm usually an 8 and got 10 for a little extra room but I'd say they fit a bit snug. Insulation is nice so layering underneath is not totally necessary.
great pant! Comfortable, warm and wind resistant.  Wore them during and windy and snowy day and was perfectly warm and dry.
Mammut provides quality product for the specific sport.  It's durable yet comfortable.  Mammut will be my "go to" ski wear product.
review.name: Perfect - Quality Product

review.reviewBody: Love the fit of these ski pants. Great for downhill runs. The added layer of fleece in these ski pants is so nice. Wind/water proof, with plenty of room for an additional layer underneath on really cold days.

name: Stoney HS Pant - Women's
