review.reviewBody: Change the whole way I look at life. 👍
review.name: Life changing

review.reviewBody: These are insanely comfortable - I can't wait to buy another pair!!
review.name: LOVE!

review.reviewBody: I am a healthcare worker and also someone who enjoys walking on more rugged terrain. I know these aren't technically walking/lifestyle shoes but they were on sale and when Hoka has a shoe on sale you have to take advantage! However to my surprise these shoes are excellent! I do about 10-15k steps at work depending on how many patients there are in the day. These shoes make my feet feel comfortable and I feel energized walking around in them.
review.name: Very comfy, vibrantly colored shoes!

review.reviewBody: The Speedgoat 5 was not wide enough for my foot. They were returned
review.name: Speedgoat

review.reviewBody: Im on my second pair of this model. I use it for long hard trail runs on rocky/sandy terrain and it has never let me down. The traction and durability is on point even in the wet seasons, and they are comfortable enough that I don't have to think about my feet when I'm running. I have never gotten a blister in these shoes even when doing a long trail run without breaking them in. I love these shoes, and I hope the newer model just adds to the greatness of these.
review.name: Ol' Reliable

review.reviewBody: It feels like you are walking on clouds and they are pushing you forward. But also very stable.
review.name: Comfy and speedy

review.reviewBody: I loved this suggestion for a running shoe. I joined a run club and these turned out to be perfect. I usually wear a 8.5 but I had to size down to a size 8. They run a little big.
review.name: Great running shoe

review.reviewBody: Very supportive, love the color too. I highly recommend. I do a lot of walking and find my feet aren't tired like they were in my old tennis shoes. Thank you for such a fine product! Mrs D. Allen
review.name: Awesome comfortable shoes

review.reviewBody: I was looking for a good shoe to hike trails in especially for a trip to Kauai. I have overpronation and usually wear brooks cause they have guiderails that alleviate the pain. However, I tried these on at Roadrunner and immediately I felt the pressure off my knees and my hips felt aligned (I also have a congenital deformity that causes back pain and hip unalignment) I find myself wearing these over my super cushioned supportive brooks. It also helps they are a pretty color. I chose these over the newer version the 6 cause those colors were so ugly I couldn't deal
review.name: I've never worn a more comfortable shoe

review.reviewBody: Speedboat are such a perfect weight for every day wearing. They are comfortable for walking, golf, and just running around. The color was a big draw and these look great on my feet!
review.name: Lightweight, comfy, and so colorful

name: Speedgoat 5 Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: As usual Selle SMP comes through with a great saddle! I have 4 different styles. While the pro is a little heavier than other saddles, it is super comfortable. I have this saddle on my Canyon road bike and love it! Highly recommend!
review.name: Selle SMP Pro Saddle

review.reviewBody:
After seeing these saddles a few times, I read the reviews and decided to try one on a new gravel bike build. I wish I would have tried their saddles a while ago. The first long ride I had on it  showed that it was quite different. So much less numbness and gone were the hot spots. You may need to play a bit with the angle, and it's a bit of a change to be in the scoop of the saddle, rather than just sitting on top of it.

Saddles are very personal, but a lot of folks never really try many out. And plenty of people never go with anything different that what came on the bike from the shop. But it can feel better, and it often takes tries before you find a saddle that fits you well. I think that I'll be sticking with SMP for a while now and want them on every bike.
review.name: I'm a convert

name: Pro Saddle

review.reviewBody: I bought this lunch for the school vibe. However it actually sucks.
review.name: Sucjs

review.reviewBody: Just the same as the one my grandfather carried! I was able to add his to my antique collection and keep this one for me to pass down. His will pass down as an antique!
review.name: Great Lunchbox!

review.reviewBody: Very durable. Well built construction on the hinges and the latch, something that is lacking in most other hard lunchboxes. Surprisingly light. The only negative is that it is very narrow in dimensions and can't hold most rectangular food containers. I wish it were an inch wider and an inch shorter.
Too small and heavy to carry and no Tupperware fits inside at all basically just for snacks
Love it! I use it for work and outings at the park.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: Love my Lunchbox.  I carry it to work every day.  I have the 10qt as well that I use for road trips and picnics.  I tell my kids that one day they can use this lunchbox or their kids will be able to.  The paint started flaking off the bottom because I would put it in my bike rack.  I sanded it, taped off the bottom, and sprayed it with a spray-on bed liner.  Worked like a charm.  I'm going to touch it up one day, but it works for now.
review.name: Family heirloom in the making

review.reviewBody: Awesome retro lunchbox for middle schooler who didn't get the Stanley cup she wanted and has never seen the show The Munsters. Highly recommend as an indestructible quality product.

description: Buy the Black Diamond Viper Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Viper Ice Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Viper Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Viper Ice Tool
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Viper Ice Tool online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This tool does both good in both the words of mountaineering and light/easy ice climbing. Is this tool my first pick for hard mixed routes and steep ice? No. Is that why you buy this tool? No. You get this tool as a bit of a do it all for expeditions where your not sure if the route will end up being steep glacier traverse or AI-3 terrain. The piece for the versatility, weight. If you will only be mountaineering then perhaps the venom is the better tool for you. For me the extra capability to proper ice climb with these tools is well worth the extra weight on the pack or in the hands. Highly recommended these tools
review.name: Good tool for light ice climbing and mountneering

review.reviewBody: Great Ice Ax with an awesome grip that keeps you moving up the mountain. Looking forward to using this more on additional adventures and wearing it in over time. Like that the tips can be replaced.
review.name: Great for Rainier

review.reviewBody: I started ice climbing a few seasons ago and tested out a lot of different tools from friends and these always felt the best, so I finally took the leap and bought my own set! They feel good in my hands and have a nice swing. Definitely recommend!
review.name: Love these tools!

review.reviewBody: Just picked these up and they were amazing for steep ice heading up and also used for a nice little assist heading down on skis through a tight icy choke. Would def recommend.
review.name: Outstanding!

review.reviewBody: Took them out for a weekend of climbing in Ouray. My partners and I all loved the new tools. Lightweight, a good swing, a comfortable shaft, and I loved the second pinky hook so I could choke up on the tool when needed.
review.name: Loved them

review.reviewBody: Great for alpine ice, think I'll need a different pair for Hyalite climbing
review.name: Great for alpine ice, think

review.reviewBody: Running up ice like some sorta gecko! This thing rocks
review.name: Sick tool!

review.reviewBody: Nice too handle and very light. Love the adjustable hand rest
review.name: Great first tools

review.reviewBody: I’m a little late to the game, better late than never, but after using tools with leashes for the past 20+ years of ice climbing, I can’t believe that I held out this long. Excellent swing balance on the tools, I have an adze and hammer and like having the adze to improve my screw placements when needed, place easily over bulges, overall very happy. I use the spinner leash since I’m usually climbing multi pitch ice but will likely not use it for single pitch ‘cragging’ days
review.name: Game Changer

review.reviewBody: I really like these ice tools. They're affordable, and have a nice feel to them. They have a slightly pick-heavy feel which I think helps for technical ice climbing.
review.name: these ice tools work perfect for me

name: Viper Ice Tool

review.reviewBody: I've had these bibs for over a month now and worn them a few times.  The quality seems to be very good and they have come through the wash well.  Sizing is about a size larger than a comparably sized Castelli imo and much more accurate based on products from other manufacturers I own.  Only thing I dont really care for is the huge GOREWEAR logos on each leg.  A bit overkill imo and would probably buy another pair if not for this fact.  Whats wrong with a discreet logo like most other brands?
review.name: Nice quality,accurate sizing,giant logos

review.reviewBody: Very comfortable, pad works for long rides, shoulder straps are not real tight making it nice for hours on end
review.name: Long ride bib shorts

review.reviewBody: The Gore Wear Distance Bib Shorts+ 2.0 are a top-notch choice for cyclists seeking a comfortable and durable pair of bib shorts. The chamois is comfortable but I’d prefer a little more cushion for an all-day bib short. Other than that, they are super comfortable. The materials offer a great balance of stretch, support, and breathability. The fabric feels soft against the skin and allows for optimal moisture management. The stretchy bib straps stay in place without digging into your shoulders, providing excellent support and stability. The leg grippers are secure yet gentle, keeping the shorts in position without causing discomfort or restriction. Overall, a really good bib short but not the best option for the longest of endurance rides.
review.name: A Solid Bib Short from Gore

name: Distance Bib Shorts+ 2.0 - Men's

review.reviewBody: Worn about 15 days.  No problem dropping a knee.  Very comfortable and good venting.  I like the option for on/off bib. The bib is form fitting and only room for a medium sweater underneath.  I keep my cell in my thigh pocket which is easy access and comfortable, but it also fits in the chest pocket.  The blue color is a little odd, like hospital scrubs, but growing on me.
review.name: Telemark

review.reviewBody: I love my Flylow Quantum Pro Jacket in size Large. I was looking for bibs that would complete my kit. The Flylow quality seems to be there on the Compound bib, but the sizing is off particularly in the chest. I followed the size chart. I am a 36" waist and a 42" chest. The Large should have fit me fine, but the bib portion was too tight even with just a thin shirt underneath. I could get it zipped, but it would not be comfortable for a day on the hill. The pants buttoned fine. I cannot see how this would fit anyone with a 44" chest.
review.name: Quality is there. Sizing is not.

review.reviewBody:
My bib came with the intuitive PERM fabric and not the eVent DV as advertised. Not only is this some "proprietary" in house fabric which means it could be anything from a secret formula to a cutting corners, but more importantly the waterproof/breathability ratings changed a lot. 

eVent DV fabric has a rating of 30k and 0.06cpm permeability while the PERM is only 20k and 0.02cpm permeability. I know anything over 10k is pretty much the same for waterproofness, but air permeability is 1/3rd of the eVent fabric, and that was the selling point for me. Also flylow markets their "proprietary" replacement fabric as the PERM and yet it has less permeability than the previous fabric, which seems more like cost savings at the expense of the consumer (price hasn't changed).

It's a real shame as the fit and finish are great (5'11, 165lbs, 32x32 and the medium fits perfect). I may still keep it for that, but I bought it for breathability and being misled by patently false marketing material (this seems to be an issue across several retailers) is a surefire way to make buyers remorseful even if your product is still excellent.
review.name: False Advertising

review.reviewBody: Let me start by saying I am NOT a bib guy, and I was disappointed to see these turn into bibs? but whatever they?re zip offs and they?re eVent fabric. Points. Figure I might as well try them out complete and HOLY COW! It?s like not even wearing pants! The uppers are light and breathable with a perfect phone or beacon pocket.  Waterproof fabrics and a good fit. I?m a bib guy now I guess.
review.name: Guess I?m a bib guy now

name: Compound Bib Pant - Men's

comment: Thank you so much for your amazing review of the Therma Tube! We’re thrilled to hear that it’s been keeping you out there longer all season long. It’s designed to elevate your experience, and we’re so glad it’s working its magic for you! Keep enjoying those adventures!

review.reviewBody:
5 stars.
Comfortable
Easy to use 
Stays dry 
Easy to breath 
Tube design, allows for aggressive skiing without overheating
review.name: Gotta have the tube

review.reviewBody:
Love the Therma Tube, this is my second one. It is the perfect weight to keep my face warm on those mild to cold days. It also breaths really well so it doesn’t get too wet around my mouth and freeze up.

I also love the print where I can represent my home mountain.
review.name: Bachelor Therma Tube!

review.reviewBody: The tube is perfect for bike riding, running and walking outside. You can easily move it into place as a mask when getting to close to others and it keeps your neck from getting sun burned. Love it!
review.name: Be safe while exercising outside

review.reviewBody: By far the best tube I own for the cooler winter months. It’s tight fitting so it stays up but it also will stretch enough for comfort. The artist print on the outside looks amazing on top of it all!
review.name: Best Tube I Own

review.reviewBody: The neck warmer is made of great fabric. It is a little too tight for me and I like them a little longer also.
review.name: Nice fabric

review.reviewBody: Gift for grandson…loves it..does exactly what it should do!!
review.name: Excellent product

review.reviewBody: This is my second Therma Tube and I adore it! The artwork is just lovely and the tube is so soft and warm. In fact I was so happy with it that I was inspired to purchase eight more (different designs) as holiday gifts for family and friends.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: This is my second Therma Tube and I adore it! The artwork is just lovely and the tube is so soft and warm. In fact I was so happy with it that I was inspired to purchase eight more (different designs) as holiday gifts for family and friends.
review.name: Love it!

review.reviewBody: I finally replaced my old fleece neck warmer with this one. It’s great!…keeps my neck protected from winter winds while skiing, but I don't get over-heated when the bluebird day warms me up! Plus, I love Megan Myers art adorning it:)
review.name: A new neck warmer for alpine skiing, finally!

name: Therma Tube

description: Buy the Shimano PD-EH500 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: PD-EH500 Pedals
hasVariant.description: Buy the Shimano PD-EH500 Pedals online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Solid pedals, compact and metal. These are a nice upgrade from stock plastic pedals. Also a great transition to riding clipless. Note that as I found out there are two different styles of cleats that screw into your cycling shoes to enable riding on clipless pedals. This pedal has the two screw mount and is for MTB shoes, generally speaking. Road shoes use the three cleat system and use a different mechanism to engage the shoe and clip into the pedal. So if you are using road shoes with the three screw cleats you need to get the other style of Shimano pedal. Highly recommend if you have MTB shoes and want the option of riding with regular shoes or cycling shoes without changing pedals.
review.name: Great transition to riding clipless

name: PD-EH500 Pedals

review.reviewBody: They look nice is all I can say positive about these shoes as to within a few minutes my feet were numb. I don't believe a 1/2 size up would do it. They were so narrow in the toes I felt was wearing women's or kid's shoes. Returned and will go another route.
review.name: NOT True to Size or even close

review.reviewBody: The Helion Elites are king! Sticky rubber, stiff, ample padding, these shoes have it all. These are casual enough to wear to the brewery after your ride and built with a performance driven design. After multiple seasons of use there has been zero durability issues. The initial break in period can feel slightly uncomfortable due to how rigid the shoe is, but after just a few rides the shoes will fit like a glove! If you haven't tried a pair of Ride Concepts they are well worth the investment.
review.name: Sticky!

review.reviewBody: I never got to ride in these beauties because when i tried them on and fell in love with them, i also realized they are for flat pedals. They seem like really excellent construction, comfortable and solid so I'm trying a different shoe from Ride Concepts and hope I like it as much as these living room warriors.
review.name: these are some beauties

name: Hellion Elite Cycling Shoe - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Subterra Rolling Carry-On 22in Bag online or shop all Travel from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: After years of holding off on buying a roller bag, (trying to build in exercise) I finally decided to buy one. Had my first work trip this week with it- 2 days in New Orleans. It was great. Easily fit a couple days of clothing, my work laptop, exercise clothes, and could have fit more. I like the feature that lets you compress clothing. It was easy to use in the airport and fit well in the overhead bins. Glad I purchased this suitcase!
review.name: My first roller suitcase and I love it

review.reviewBody: It's difficult to find a two wheel roller bag.  Living in the city and traveling to places like Europe, I find that small spinner bag wheels aren't as smooth over streets and sidewalks.  The large wheels on this bag are very smooth and roll easily over crack and crevices.  I also added the compression cubes and was surprised with how much I was able to fit for a true carry-on size bag.  The zipper compartment on the top is also very handy.  The overall look is sleek and modern.  I really love the dark blue with the contrasting interior.  Already ordered the coordinating backpack and can't wait to use them both on my next trip.
review.name: Practical & Modern

review.reviewBody: The bag is great, amazing quality and super functional.plus it looks great.
review.name: Great bag

review.reviewBody:
This lightweight carryon is not light on space! I packed for a full week’s worth of athletic and casual
dining clothes. Compact but holds a lot especially if you learn how to roll everything. Athletic but also stylish travel piece.
review.name: Lightweight carry-on

review.reviewBody: One trip in the books, and love how my Thule performed. The sturdiness of the workmanship was one of the main features I was looking for. Also, I preferred the 2 wheels vs. 4 wheels, that other brands use. Inside, the compartments made it easy to arrange goods, and the featured compression sheath definitely helped in being able to add more clothing.
review.name: Met/exceded my expectations after first vacation.

review.reviewBody: I really like this suitcase -- however, I had a small part of the handle broken, and they would not give me the ability to fix it.  It seems very wasteful to have to commit that much of  a fully functioning product to a landfill because such a small component didnt fit
review.name: love product - cannot repair
comment:
Hello Bob, 
Thank you for sharing your feedback on the Thule Subterra Carry On Luggage. I'm sorry to hear about the damage to your bag. Sustainability and environmental ethics is an important part of Thule's operations, and we are always looking for ways to make our products not only easier to use and safer, but also for ways to limit our impact on the world.
While many of our products feature replaceable and repairable parts, some components are not replaceable based on how they are assembled, or to ensure they are secure for use. This is unfortunately one of those cases, and would need to be addressed through a warranty claim on the luggage. 
Thule is currently assessing ways to improve upon our commitment to sustainability, so feedback like this is important and welcome.

review.reviewBody: Bought for husband, he simply loves it, we ordered the forest green colour so it is easy to find on the baggage carousel!  Durable, spacious, elegant and so far hasn't been killed off or damaged by airline handlers!
review.name: Durable and stands out in the crowd!

review.reviewBody: We recently used this bag for a trip to the islands. Not only was it a very attractive looking bag but I can’t believe how much we were able to fit using the compression panel feature. The clothes remained unwrinkled as well. We will be purchasing  another of these bags so that both my husband and I  can each have one. Now that we have used the Subterra neither of us wants to go back to our “other” bags. Another great design by Thule.
review.name: Best Carry On Ever!

review.reviewBody: Easily handled on stairs of metro, over cobblestones, through airports.
review.name: I would buy this smooth rolling, quick packing case again.

review.reviewBody: Love the looks, features, and build quality. I'm about to hit the mean streets of Manhattan, and this bag will have no problem.
review.name: This is "the one."

name: Subterra Rolling Carry-On 22in Bag

review.reviewBody: I bought these at the end of last year, and they have proven to be a great season transition pair of pants. I've been wearing them walking and to football games. They are cute, cozy, and comfortable. They fit true to size.
review.name: Cozy and comfortable

review.reviewBody: I love these pants. I went two sizes up because I read that they were mid-rise and I prefer high-rise. I usually wear an 8 or M or 29/30", but I got a 12 in these. They ended up fitting well - definitely loose, but there is a belt loop if needed. My legs are instantly warm when I put them on. I love that they have front and back pockets. Great buy for the sales price.
review.name: Warm and cute

review.reviewBody: Bought these for a trip to Iceland. Warm pant with a flattering cut, color and shape! They are a mid-rise. Given this, I'd size up. I'm anywhere from a 4 to a 6 in pants (usually 26 in jeans, size 4-6 in lululemon). I initially ordered a 4 and it was just a touch too small in the hips and short in the crotch area. Size 6 is a bit loose in some places but perfect for my hips, plus there are belt loops! Highly recommend.
review.name: Adorable

review.reviewBody: These are the perfect pants to wear to and from my winter plunge practice. Warm, easy, wind proof. And stylish .
review.name: Love these, warm stylish, durable

review.reviewBody: These pants are great. They are very warm with soft feeling fabric. They do not have any stretch. I size up one size and glad i did. Length is cropped, which i like a lot. Not a high-waisted, more like mid-rise. Color green is amazing. Quality on point. Recommended.
review.name: Great warm pants

name: Oakbury Synthetic Quilted Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: This beanie is ridiculously small, both in height and in width. The description "snug fitting that loosens with wear" I couldn't even get the beanie on my head! I wish I wouldn't have purchased this item, because I wouldn't had to waste $15 in paying for shipping and return item for this garbage product
review.name: Had to return - ridiculously small

review.reviewBody: The color, material, and warmth are nice. It fits snug on my head. I hope it loosens up over time.
review.name: Warm and Tight

review.reviewBody:
Let it be known that I’ve got one big dang head so I try not to get my hopes up with “one size fits all” products. But, goodness, were my expectations shattered! This beanie initially started a bit snug but conformed to my head after just a couple of wears without losing its snazzy shape.
Cozy, snug fit that provides great warmth without sacrificing good looks!
review.name: Big Time Cozy!

review.reviewBody: Seriously, The best beanie I've ever owned. I've worn it everyday I've needed to for the last 3 years. Living in Denver, that's a lot of days. I wear it hiking, snowboarding, camping, out and about, really anywhere. It's only needed to be washed a handful of times, doesn't pill, doesn't smell, and keeps its shape. I want to buy a few more just to keep incase they ever discontinue this beanie.
review.name: The Best Beanie

review.reviewBody: Love this beanie!  Super warm and stretchy, and not itchy at all!
review.name: Great Beanie!

review.reviewBody: Nice material with good stitching. Smaller fit than other beanies. Perfect if you like to wear high on your head
review.name: Small fit

review.reviewBody: I've seen other complain about this hat being small but wanted to give it a shot regardless. For me, the length was fine but the hat was suctioned to my head. I can't imagine it stretching enough to not look like I'm wearing a swimmers cap. Super disappointed because the colors are great too
review.name: So cute, so small

name: Fishermans Rolled Beanie

review.reviewBody: After much trial and error, I have found that the Moji Lantern is the best overall for use in the Boundary Waters - they are rouged and have found that they stand up to a high water/wet environment. The variable brightnesses on the Moji means that I can have the lantern on all nights if needed. They are lite weight, very durable and dependable. I bought my first ones many years ago, and just bought two more, the old ones are in service to date still. The attached hanging system can attach to almost anything. They can face down or up, they are worth the investment and will give many years of service.
review.name: Best Boundary Waters Lantern

review.reviewBody: I have bought other mini Lights for everyday use in closets , garage, basement stairs, but all pale in comparison to the strength and width of this dimmable little gem.
review.name: Great spotlight for Closets to Camping

review.reviewBody: It throws great light in a little easy-to-use package! Gifting to family and friends!
review.name: It throws great light in

review.reviewBody: Exceeded my expectatiohs. It provides a wide and bright light.
review.name: bright and light

review.reviewBody: Super challenge to insert Triple A’s but after two frustrating attempts, I am now ready for the apocalypse.
review.name: Not intuitive

review.reviewBody: Which is needed to install the batteries. The instruction sheet type is so small that I can't read it. . . even with a magnifying glass. Could not find online instrucions.
review.name: Cannot open the lantern

review.reviewBody: Despite other positive reviews, I didn’t expect this lantern to perform as well as it does. They are absolutely terrific. Will use them as emergency tool kept in car glovebox and stashed away for the inevitable power outages to come.
review.name: Fabulous lanterns

review.reviewBody: Great lantern to keep in a jacket pocket, good battery life and brightness for nearly all night tasks.
review.name: Small but mighty

review.reviewBody: Small and compact when you just can't afford to carry much weight. Durable and runs a long time on a charge or some alkaline batteries. It fits some great needs when camping remotely.
review.name: Big illumination, small size

review.reviewBody: Dimmable, versatile, easy to pack. This little guy goes with me everywhere; a tent, a cabin, or hotel. I'm done with flashlights.
review.name: Great Little Light

review.itemreviewed: Rascal Select BOA Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Comfortable, high quality shoe.
Positive features:
 medial ankle protection, 
boa closure dial on the tongue which lessens odds of breaking it off in a crash
decent rubber for off the bike scrambles and good toe box protection
good styling

Note: Sizing is on the large side. I am a size 42.5 and wear a 43 in Shimano shoes. These shoes fit me well in a size 42.
review.name: MTB shoe with Boa in the right place!

review.reviewBody: I wanted some new hiking shoes for a long trek, broke them in a few months being backing the TMB. I spent 10 days backpacking and i just had these and my camp sandals. Yes, my feet were tired and sore each day but thats to be expected with any long and hard day. But what i didnt have were any hot spots, blisters or heavy feet. These were stable and grippy. Held up great and looked good to boot. The laces felt secure and didnt constantly come undone. I had secure footing and comfort with our backpacking gear. I wish i at times at more ankle support, but i didnt want the added weight. Happy with my purchase and didnt mind paying full price when i walked away blister free! Got my normal size 7s and were happy with the size, room for swollen tired feet but also not too big and never felt snug.
review.name: Adventures Begin

review.reviewBody: Barbour has always made excellent quality products. But they dropped the ball on the sizing of this coat!! I’m 5’3” and weigh 105. Usually wear 0-1 . Small shoulder frame. Ordered size US 8. Wanted to wear cover sweaters. It was so small through arms and shoulders that I couldn’t raise my arms at all. Arm width is child size at best.Tried on over a light shirt. Exchange for the biggest size 12 and still very tight across shoulder and underarms. Looks like I will be returning it. Backcountry was excellent with customer service. This is entirely on the maker. All the other Barbour coats I have run true to size. Very disappointed!!
review.name: Please read!! Beautiful coat, But!!!

review.reviewBody: Unfortunately, I had the same issues as many others have had..  Very surprised considering I have MANY Barbour jackets, so I felt confident in the sizing.  Have worn a US 14 recently, and there was no way the jacket would zip, and I would need twigs for arms in order for them to fit in the sleeves.  So disappointed.  Don't think I will order a larger size in this case - not worth the hassle if it still doesn't fit.
review.name: Sizing definitely off

review.reviewBody: This is a beautiful jacket, but I'm returning it because pockets are odd. You can only put your hands in the pockets from the top (of pocket), not from the sides (naturally at your waist). This is just awkward and uncomfortable. Re. size, I went up per reviews. I'm usually a 4 (SP/4P) and the 6 fit well. The Windsor/Brown color is rich and gorgeous. I really wanted to love this jacket!
review.name: Gorgeous jacket, pockets not ideal

review.reviewBody: Beautiful Jacket as you would expect with Barbour. The only problem I had, which many people have talked about was the sizing being so off.  I am normally a size 4 so ordered a 4 and a 6 and both were very, very small!  Very tight in the elbows which I hate in shirts or jackets.  Sent both back and ordered an 8 and a 10.  I wanted to be able to layer under.  The 8 was perfect with a sweater.  So odd to have to go up two sizes, but it’s a fantastic jacket for fall.
review.name: Cavalry Polarquilt Jacket

review.reviewBody: Really wanted to love this jacket. The color (dark red) is fabulous. No cool undertone to it. I am 5' 8" and weigh 115 lbs. I normally wear a size US 2. I knew that wouldn't fit, so I started with a size US 4. Too small. Armholes and sleeves were tight. Tried a US 6. Same problem. The jacket isn't very packable - polartec- and it's kinda heavy. Guess I am spoiled to jackets like the Patagonia Nano Puff.
review.name: Small

review.reviewBody: For reference, I am 5'9", 175lbs, I wear a small (mediums are typically fairly loose) on top, true hourglass shape. I have always been a UK size 8 - but I sized up to a 10 for this one. Got it, and it was tight tight to the point where I didn't bother to try to get it fully on. Sized up to a size 16 and that was still very tight on the arms. Going to try to size up once more to the 18 (!) and see if that helps, but I feel like the sizing is just all over the place on this jacket. Otherwise, lovely cut and warmth.
review.name: Quality is fantastic, sizing is WAY off

review.reviewBody: Great jacket, thought I would include my sizing info because I think it's a bit tricky. I'm usually a small, US 4, 34B, 27 denim. The US 4/UK8 I could zip up but I needed to suck in the belly and was only wearing a light layer, much too snug around the midsection, snug around arms, and fit well in the shoulders (I have small shoulders).  Re-ordered a US 6/UK 10 fingers crossed it will be roomy enough to wear a light sweater knit underneath and zip up. It's cut in a true hourglass shape.
review.name: Quality jacket

review.reviewBody: Gave it as a gift. A good quality and simple jacket.
review.name: Nice jacket

review.reviewBody: Ordered this jacket in a size 10, since most reviews suggested to go up a size or two. When I received the jacket it was a lot larger than I had expected on me. Love the style, quality, and color however! I contacted Backcountry, and right away they sent me a smaller size along with a return labeler the one I had. Customer service was truly fantastic! For me this jacket fit to size. Thank you Backcountry for all your help!
review.name: Love this jacket!

name: Cavalry Polarquilt Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: Really like it. Wish it came in more light colors and more breathable fabric.
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody:
Love the material, fit, comfort. Price is competitive.

I would prefer it to be maybe 2" (?) longer in length to help keep tucked in waist line throughout the day. I'm a thin 5' 10", 170lb guy. 

Arm cuff stitching coming loose after x 2 uses, no wash.
review.name: Nice Shirt!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is a really warm shirt for chilly days and for your workouts. I love the color and I love the fact that I got it on sale. Thank you, Marmot.
review.name: Great shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Love this shirt. Great fit and feel, and soft to the touch. My new favorite.
review.name: Men's Windridge Long-Sleeve T-Shirt

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Good fit. Nice base layer for semi cold days or worn on it's own in cool weather. Having the thumb through the sleeves helps while one wheeling.
review.name: Practical for one wheeling

review.reviewBody: I’ve worn this type of shirt for years but I’ve noticed the quality of the material has gotten cheaper and the thumb holes give it a nice homeless look and feel. It would be nice to at least have an option for the sleeve thumb holes. Other than that, I will wear but will not order more until they fix this.
review.name: Thumb holes are the worst idea in marmot history.
comment:
Thank you for providing us with feedback on our product. We truly appreciate you bringing the matter to our attention.

I am very sorry to hear that the item has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about an appropriate solution for the future. Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us or through LiveChat. We’re available Mon-Fri, 9AM - 5PM EST

Thank you,
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] As a Marmot-Fanatic, no surprise I found these to be super comfortable, warm, I’m 5’6”/165lbs… Mediums were too big/long… Small was better.  
Great running shirt I go to often.  Love the thumb holes!
review.name: Running Long Sleeve Tee

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I’ve been buying/using Marmot products for over 40 years and Marmot always delivers. These shirts are no exception. Love the look, the style, the fit and the function! They’re great for the Trail or a night out on the town. I’m 6’3” 195lbs. And size large fits perfectly.
review.name: Great shirts!

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Pad works well.  Comfortable for side and back sleeping. It took a little to get used to the “gap” feeling in the pad between the baffles but that was only the initial few moments - after that it was comfortable. I found it a little less comfortable than one of my other pads at lower inflation and in the really cold. It has a lower R rating than my other one so as expected. I would be comfortable on this one down to 40 degrees.
review.name: Works

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: good pad. works well. it could be a bit wider so that it stays under you better in a hammock setup.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I have used it twice now for backpacking and it is very light and comfortable.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I just returned from a late September archery elk hunt at 12,000 feet living out of my backpack and this made all the difference in getting a good nights rest after a hard day. The only complaint I would have is that my sleeping bag would slide on the sleeping pad and if not completely level ground, you end up off the pad.
review.name: Great compact sleep pad.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: I've been using this on camping trips for years for solo sleeping arrangements. In my opinion the only thing better would be the ultra-lite variation.
review.name: Static V Lite

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Klymit has a weight of 20oz for this pad on their website and expert voice lists it as 19.6.  Mine weighs in at 22.6oz without the stuff sack.  Makes me wonder whether the listed R-value is accurate.  Also note, mine did not come with a patch kit like my previous Klymit pads.
review.name: Good pad for the price
comment: We are sorry to hear that you are not fully satisfied. Your feedback is important to us, and we'd like to address your concerns. Please contact us at support@klymit.com or 1-888-655-3632 so we can work on improving your experience. Your satisfaction is our top priority.

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: Light and insulated?  Yes and yes.  Will be ready for the next winter season wandering the Grand Canyon.
review.name: Why did I wait so long?

review.itemreviewed: Insulated Static V Lite Sleeping Pad
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, small footprint when folded up for traveling, good support.

hasVariant.name: Sidewinder SL Sleeping Bag: 20F Down
hasVariant.description: Buy the Big Agnes Sidewinder SL Sleeping Bag: 20F Down online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
First the good stuff - Bag is (1) adequately warm (I've taken it down to 20 degrees F),  (2) fits well, and (3) is lightweight. If those are your only criteria, then it's perfectly fine.

Now the not so good stuff - (1) I've used the bag for 2 years and it leaks feathers everywhere. I contacted Big Agnes and they say that it is normal for feathers to escape through the lightweight fabric, so you should see them from time to time. However, it loses a lot of feathers every single night. My tent and clothes are covered with them every morning. (2) The zipper always gets stuck on the fabric. It's just a pain. If I use it like a normal zipper, then it gets caught on the fabric 100% of the time. If I very carefully guide the zipper, then I am successful maybe 70% of the time. 

Overall, if I could go back in time then I would just get a different bag. It's quite expensive and you can get something better for the price. Maybe I got a bad bag that leaks an unusual amount of feathers, but Big Agnes didn't offer to replace it.
review.name: Could get a better bag for the price
